Stumptown ComicsFest Shindigs

Posted on April 27, 2012April 27, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

If you’re not sure what to do with yourself after the Stumptown ComicsFest convention hall closes, PGC3 member organizations are helping bring you the party. There are metric tons of cool geek events on the Stumptown ComicsFest calendar all weekend, but the splashiest bashes are on Saturday night:

First off, the Jupiter Hotel plays host to the Stumptown Comicsfest Fundraising After Party, presented by Oni Press and Stumptown Comics, and hosted by Bobby Roberts of the Cort and Fatboy show.

From their event annoucement:

[Stumptown Comicsfest After Party is] a full night of music, art, beer, and fun inspired by comics and the awesome people who love and make them! All attendees and guests with badges admitted to the party for free, open to the public for $5 Admission. Proceeds benefit Comic Book Legal Defense Fund, Independent Publishing Resource Center’s Dylan Williams Memorial Scholarship Fund and Stumptown Comics.

The party features the presentation of the Stumptown Comic Arts Awards, a rare live musical performance by Stumptown special guest Mike Allred and his band The Gear, and the annual Stumptown Comic Art Battle hosted by Paul Guinan! Plus beer by Ninkasi Brewery!

Stumptown ComicsFest Fundraiser After Party
Sat. April 28, 2012
7pm – 11pm
FREE with Stumptown ComicsFest pass, $5 for general public
Jupiter Hotel 
800 E. Burnside Street
Portland, OR 97214

Second, geek burlesque makes its comeback just up the street at the Bossanova Ballroom, when Geeklesque Saves the World brings you a bevy of comics-inspired, tassel-twirling acts.

Assemble your team, light up the burly signal, and charge up your power ring! Critical Hit Burlesque invites you to celebrate comic book superheroes and comic strip classics with Geeklesque Saves the World! Saves the World is an all comics-themed show, with acts based around superheroes and comic adventurers of all sorts.

Presented at the Bossanova Ballroom, Saves the World will be a two show engagement, with performances starting at 7:30pm and 11:00pm on Saturday, April 28, 2012. Hosted by the Mad Marquis, Saves the World will feature a selection of new and familiar Geeklesque performers, including:

Baby Le’Strange
Sophie Maltease
Lizzy O’Boom
Burlesquire
Lady Stockholm
with fusion bellydance by Elise
and joining us from Epic Win Burlesque in New York City: Mary Cyn!

We highly recommend checking out both events after you’ve sated your comics cravings, and if you don’t have your ticket to Stumptown ComicsFest yet? DO IT NOW: one-day and weekend passes are available for the convention!

Geeklesque Saves The World!
Sat. April 29, 2012
1st show: doors 6:30pm / show 7:30pm - 2nd show: doors 10pm / show 11pm
General Admission: $12 advance / $15 at the door
Reserved Balcony Seating: $20 (advance sale only)
VIP reserved seating w/2 drink tickets: $35 (advance sale only)
Bossanova Ballroom
722 E. Burnside
Portland, OR 97214

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and web site geekery for Portland small businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

A Look Back at ECCC 2012

Posted on April 20, 2012April 20, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

PGC3 Members were out in force at this year’s Emerald City Comicon, exploring the latest wonders that the comics and art world has to offer. ECCC is a big-deal event with some high-profile media guests, but it hasn’t strayed from its geeky core of sequential art, whether they be long-recognized big-name heroes, or imaginative stories from independent creatives.

Here’s a small taste of what some of our PGC3 folk were up to, during their visit to Seattle:

Chronicles of the Nerds took their podcast on the road for two days of coverage at ECCC. You can download Day One and Day Two of their ECCC coverage on their web site, or subscribe on iTunes and snag every episode on the regular.

PDX Browncoats manned a table for the entire con, and spread the gospel of the awesome work they’re doing, including their highly-successful Can’t Stop The Serenity charity screenings.

PDX Browncoats also played host to Portland’s beloved nerd/folk band The Doubleclicks on Day 2, when the duo set up for a visit, and played a few numbers for passers-by!

The Doubleclicks in action at the PDX Browncoats booth! Photo courtesy Sarah G Creative.

Meanwhile, our friends at Things From Another World were hard at work running their own booth, and also grabbing video interviews and taking photos. Take a look at their interview with Francis Manapul and Brian Buccellato, and their chat with Chris Roberson and Rich Ellis, or you can look through some of their favorite photos from ECCC on Facebook.

And, I also wandered the exhibition hall capturing photos, while intrepid writer Joe Streckert chatted with Portland comics creators, for our three-day coverage of ECCC for the Portland Mercury. A few favorite shots of mine are on my blog at Sarah G Creative, or check out Day One, Day Two, and Day Three on the Portland Mercury blog for full galleries of each day.

What were you up to at ECCC 2012? What were your favorite moments? Share with us in the comments!

Bye bye, ECCC '12. Photo courtesy Sarah G Creative.

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and geekery for small and local Portland businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

All-Hands Meeting: April 23rd!

Posted on April 9, 2012April 5, 2012 by admin

We’d love for everyone to join us for an all hands meeting at The Funhouse Lounge (2432 SE 11th Ave., just north of SE Division) from 6pm to 8pm on Monday, April 23rd.

The primary items to be discussed are the PGC3′s Olympathon coming in May, and the PGC3 booth at Stumptown Comics Fest. Additionally, the board is pleased to announce our new organizational status as a 501(c)(6) organization.

The Funhouse Lounge is the home of PGC3 Members the Unscriptables, and is a ‘Beer and shots’ bar serving beer, wine (including Sangria) and shots of the hard stuff alongside great food, so plenty of options for all (you might want to bring cash, just to make things easy on the staff). The lounge is all-ages until 7pm, for those who need that option. More details at http://funhouselounge.com/.

Stay Geeky!
Marc a.k.a. the Mad Marquis

PGC3 All-Hands Meeting
Monday, April 23rd, 6:00pm-8:00pm
The Funhouse Lounge
2432 SE 11th Ave.
Portland 97202

CONTRIBUTOR: Marc, a.k.a. The Mad Marquis, is MC and artistic director of Critical Hit Burlesque, which strives to combine great local burlesque with classic geek culture themes, through their Geeklesque series and other monthly Portland shows.

TOMORROW: Night of the Living Donors!

Posted on April 5, 2012April 5, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

This Friday is your chance to fight back against the threat of the undead: PGC3 member organization the Jupiter Hotel is joining forces with the Zombie Squad to bring you, “Night of the Living Donors,” a blood drive to benefit the American Red Cross.

On April 6th, shamble on over to the Jupiter to make a blood donation, enter to win prizes, showcase your favorite zombie or zombie hunter costumer, and do it for a good cause!

From Zombie Squad’s press release:

All presenting donors get a free burrito from Chipotle Mexican Grill to fuel their fight. Enter to win prizes from Portland’s “May of the Dead” celebration, Things From Another World comic book store and Zombie Squad - Oregon Chapter! Jupiter Hotel will also provide complimentary orange juice and First Friday art gallery access for all donors! Snacks, cookies and coffee will be served, along with other standard refreshment items.

Scope out upcoming “May of the Dead” events and other zombie activities and get educated on disaster prep from Zombie Squad, who will have a “bug out bag” (BOB) display and trifolds of propoganda. Dress the part for extra kudos and snap photos with Zombie Squad’s costumed hunters and minions of the undead.

If you’re ready to donate, you can schedule an appointment in advance by phone (1-800 RED CROSS), or visit redcrossblood.org and enter sponsor code: zombiesquad to register as a donor for Night of the Living Donors. Appointments are preferred, but not required, so you can still join in and donate without an appointment.

Night of the Living Donors
Friday, April 6th, 3 –8 p.m.
Jupiter Hotel
800 E Burnside St.
Portland, OR

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and geekery for small and local Portland businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

TODAY: Indie Video Game Showcase and Crowd Funding Jam

Posted on March 30, 2012March 29, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

If you’ve been batting around game ideas in your brain, then today’s BarCamp 6 session, organized by new Portland startup Pixel Arts, might be just the kick you need to turn your idea into a reality. The Indie Video Game Showcase and Crowd Funding Jam session will explore how you can harness the awesome power of crowdfunding to get your indie game project off the ground, and how

If you’d rather play games instead of making them, they’ll also be showcasing indie games like “Space Tetherball,” “Abyss” and “Claustrophobic Typing,” as well as a pre-release version of Johann Sebastian Joust, a graphic-less 7 player game using motion controllers, made by Die Gute Fabrik, a small games studio based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Other entries from the local community are also totally welcome and encouraged!

From their recent press release:

In February, video game company Double Fine Adventure asked fans to support their new game by contributing $400,000. After only twelve hours, pledges exceeded $1 million. After less than 30 days, their game became the most funded project in Kickstarter history with over 87 thousand backers contributing more than $3.3 million. In total, they had reached 834% of their funding goal.

Double Fine Adventure’s success has generated massive excitement among indie developers & gamers everywhere. Instead of needing loans or credit, creators are finding new opportunities through our vibrant global community. At BarCamp Portland 6, we will showcase indie video games and explore crowd funding models. The goal of our event is to help local developers and entrepreneurs prototype their projects and discover best practices for crowd funding.

Participate in our Portland Crowdfunding Thought Experiment

Our game is simple: show your preference amongst 10 KickStarter projects currently seeking funding in the Pacific NW. We’ll be using a simplified form of Dotmocracy – everyone will get to +1 a project using one of the five stickers we’ll give you at the start. It’s cool if you’ve never heard of this Dotmocracy thing before. This is BarCamp. There will be a demo.

The goal of our game is discover best practices and explore how to create local block funding using Kickstarter as a platform. Our jam session, facilitated by Todd Pitt of Zero Strategist, will examine alternative models like IndieGoGo and StartSomeGood. At the end, Pixel Arts will give $200 plus any additional funds raised to the winning Kickstarter project.

March 30th, 6:30-9pm
Eliot Center, 1226 SW Salmon St, Portland, OR 97205
Free with BarCamp 6 RSVP (RSVP at http://barcampportland6.eventbrite.com/)

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and geekery for small and local Portland businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

THIS WEEKEND: Gamestorm Returns!

Posted on March 22, 2012March 21, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

This weekend, the Vancouver Hilton will be taken over for four days of gaming madness, when GameStorm returns for its 14th year! GameStorm has grown into one of the biggest gaming events in the Northwest, and it’ll have entertaining diversions for board gamers, role players, and console enthusiasts, and more.

From their press release:

“GameStorm continues to provide four days of non-stop gaming of all kinds,” said Jason Bostick, head of outreach for GameStorm. “From card and dice games to tabletop role playing, from video and LAN gaming to live action role playing, you will never be wanting for a game.

In addition to gaming, there will be workshops, a swap meet, a miniatures painting contest, and a game lab, where game creators can test their prototype to the general public. Honored guests this year include Andrew Hackard and Sam Mitschke from Steve Jackson Games, as well as Jason Bulmahn from Paizo Games. These major players in the gaming community will lead panel discussions and provide demonstrations.

Additional entertainment includes the screening of Going Cardboard, a feature-length documentary on game designers, publishers, and their fans. Following the film ther will be a Q&A with the filmmaker. On Saturday night the Doubleclicks, a local musical duo, will perform their original pieces on geek life and gaming.

Gamestorm 14
March 22nd-25th, 2012
$45 for four-day pass, $10-30 for one-day passes
Vancouver Hilton
301 W. 6th Street
Vancouver, WA

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and geekery for small and local Portland businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you.

The Triforce Tribute: An epic exhibition celebrating all things Zelda.

Posted on March 16, 2012March 21, 2012 by admin

Legend of Zelda tribute art show going on here in Portland at Land Gallery starting March 9th, called the Triforce Tribute. It is being curated by two Portland-based design and illustration teams, Jolby and Always With Honor. The show is featuring some heavy hitters in the world of Illustration and design, such as:


Olly Moss


Eric Coddington


Dan Cassaro (Young Jerks)


Jolby


Meg Hunt


Trevor Basset


Jeffery Frankenhauser

For a list of all of the artists, including sneak peeks to amazing work that is being done, visit the Triforce Tribute website, here. Here are the details:

Triforce Tribute
Land Gallery
3925 North Mississippi Ave
Portland, Oregon 97227

Opening: March 9th
Running through: April 21st
Admission: Free

CONTRIBUTOR: Neal Bauer is the creator and host of the ++Good (Double Plus Good) Games website and podcast. ++Good Games is about celebrating the best games, the most innovative game developers and the greatest gaming experiences this industry has to offer. Along the way, we want to share what has made this industry so exceptional these past 40 years.
